snapshot:
Dominic Theo

I am a data scientist and computer engineer interested in the anonymous web. Previous areas of research include Tor, Bitcoin, Ethereum, BitMessage, dark markets and general censorship issues. I maintain this anonymous identity in order to have more freedom in what I research, as these technologies are frequently used for activities on the fringes of the present day nation-state law.

Experience

The nature of my work precludes the disclosure of previous projects. Trust is the central issue of these new technologies, and the only way to establish it in this situation is to start talking. I have extensive experience of common systems and web languages, and in various distributed network protocols.

Hire Me

I’m available for research and general programming projects that have at least something to do with the anonymous web.

The way this works is:

  1. You email me with a sketch of your project
  2. I respond with ideas
  3. We keep talking and working
  4. We discuss an incremental delivery/payment schedule

Security

You can always be sure you’re talking to me, Dominic Theo (an alias), by verifying my messages against the GPG public key below. I encourage you to sign your own messages. A signature for this web page may be found here.
